title: Why Technests Built Dr. Markets and TradeRx for Modern Prop Trading
excerpt:
The Prop Trading Problem Nobody Likes to Admit

On the surface, prop trading looks simple.

Pass an evaluation. Get a funded account. Withdraw profits. Repeat.
content:
The Prop Trading Problem Nobody Likes to Admit

On the surface, prop trading looks simple.

Pass an evaluation. Get a funded account. Withdraw profits. Repeat.

In reality, most traders quickly discover something uncomfortable: they don’t usually fail because their strategy is terrible. They fail because of:

◇ Broken discipline
◇ Rule violations they didn’t fully understand
◇ Inconsistent execution under stress

Modern prop firms are not casual environments. They run structured businesses with strict rule sets:

◇ Trailing drawdowns
◇ Daily loss limits
◇ Consistency requirements
◇ News trading restrictions
◇ Scaling plans and payout conditions

These rules are not suggestions. They’re stress tests. One mistake on ES, NQ, or GC can invalidate weeks of good trading.

At Technests, we faced the same reality that funded traders do: no amount of instinct or chart-reading skill will save you if the process around your trades isn’t systemized.

That’s why we built Dr. Markets and TradeRx—not as magic bots, but as infrastructure for serious futures traders who want their trading to behave like a business instead of a sequence of impulses.

The Core Truth: Prop Firms Fund Systems, Not Hope

This is the shift many traders never fully make:

Prop firms are not looking for talented gamblers. They are looking for reliable systems.

They care less about:

◇ One huge NQ breakout trade
◇ A random day where you triple size on ES
◇ A lucky GC reversal you caught on instinct

They care much more about:

◇ Whether you respect drawdown limits
◇ Whether your equity curve is stable, not erratic
◇ Whether your behavior fits their risk model
◇ Whether your process can survive bad days without collapse

Across prop environments, the same pattern shows up over and over: the majority of failures come from rule and behavior issues, not pure strategy failure.

The real problem isn’t just “where to enter.”

The real problem is everything around the trade.

Why Technests Built Dr. Markets

Dr. Markets exists to do what most traders try to do in their heads and rarely execute consistently: plan the trading day in a way that respects both the market environment and the prop firm rulebook.

It was built to address some specific recurring problems we saw in futures prop trading.

News Traps

High-impact events like CPI, FOMC, and NFP are responsible for a large share of blown evaluations and funded accounts.

Traders often:

◇ Enter too close to the release
◇ Hold positions through restricted windows
◇ Underestimate volatility on ES, NQ, or GC

Dr. Markets is designed to build your plan around these events, not through them. The intent is to help you avoid being in the wrong place at the wrong time—not to promise protection from every spike or gap.

Time-Based Traps and Consistency

Many prop firms require:

◇ A minimum number of trading days
◇ Profits spread out to meet consistency rules

Traders routinely:

◇ Hit the profit target too fast
◇ Cluster big wins into one or two days
◇ Then fail on “consistency,” despite overall positive PnL

Dr. Markets helps you structure exposure across sessions so your plan reflects what the firm actually wants to see: controlled, repeatable behavior instead of lottery-style equity curves.

Risk Allocation and Drawdown Awareness

Oversizing after a win and undersizing after a loss are classic behavioral errors.

Dr. Markets helps define:

◇ Daily risk envelopes
◇ Trade-by-trade dollar risk aligned with max drawdown
◇ How many contracts on ES, NQ, or GC are reasonable for that account size and rule set

It doesn’t stop all bad decisions—but it forces you to confront risk in writing before the session starts.

Evaluation vs Funded Behavior

Evaluation accounts and funded accounts do not have the same objectives.

◇ Evaluations often reward reaching a target quickly without breaking rules
◇ Funded accounts reward survival, consistency, and controlled drawdown

Dr. Markets allows different planning assumptions for each phase, so you’re not using “evaluation mode” aggression in a live funded futures account where one misstep can kill payout potential.

A Mirror for Trader Psychology

Because planning is explicit, Dr. Markets becomes a mirror:

◇ Did you follow your plan or override it?
◇ Are you constantly adding “just one more” condition?
◇ Do you keep pushing risk beyond what you wrote down?

The tool doesn’t fix psychology on its own—but it makes your behavior visible and measurable instead of invisible and rationalized.

Why Technests Built TradeRx

If Dr. Markets is the planner, TradeRx is the executor.

We built TradeRx after seeing the same pattern:

Traders know what they should do. Then the market opens. Adrenaline rises. Rules drift.

TradeRx exists to close that gap between plan and execution.

Rule Compliance in Real Time

Within the constraints you configure, TradeRx can help enforce:

◇ Daily loss thresholds
◇ Simple trailing drawdown buffers
◇ Time-based restrictions you define (e.g., no trading around major news windows)

It’s not connected to every prop firm’s back-end logic, and it can’t see everything a firm might do internally. But it can keep you inside the limits you set, based on the rules you understand.

Execution Precision

Delays and hesitation at entry are common sources of slippage and second-guessing.

With predefined logic:

◇ Orders can be placed quickly and consistently
◇ Stops and targets can be attached automatically
◇ You spend less time scrambling with order tickets and more time supervising the bigger picture

TradeRx doesn’t guarantee perfect fills. All trading through NinjaTrader, Rithmic, CQG, or any other routing is still subject to latency, partial fills, and occasional platform issues. But it reduces avoidable execution noise.

Emotional Guardrails

After a string of losses, many traders:

◇ Increase size impulsively
◇ Shorten stops irrationally
◇ Take trades outside their usual time windows

Configured properly, TradeRx can:

◇ Pause trading after a certain number of consecutive losses
◇ Prevent size increases beyond agreed limits
◇ Refuse to enter new trades outside your allowed schedule

You can override it, but if you do, that decision is visible in your logs. There’s no pretending later that you “stuck to the system.”

Journaling and Honest Review

One of the most valuable but underused tools in trading is proper journaling.

TradeRx can support a structured record that may include:

◇ Time-stamped entries and exits
◇ Market instrument (ES, NQ, GC, etc.)
◇ Direction, size, and outcome
◇ Tags for rule-compliant vs rule-breaking trades

This doesn’t automatically make you profitable. What it does is give you a realistic picture of how your trading behaves over time—instead of just remembering the best and worst days.

Why Technests Chose a Dual-Tool Approach

We didn’t combine everything into one giant “black box” for a reason.

In every high-stakes environment—aviation, surgery, professional trading—planning and execution are treated as separate layers:

◇ One layer looks at context, timelines, constraints, and strategy
◇ Another layer focuses on precise execution within that context

At Technests:

◇ Dr. Markets focuses on planning and constraints
◇ TradeRx focuses on execution and enforcement

This separation:

◇ Reduces complexity in each layer
◇ Makes behavior easier to audit and refine
◇ Mirrors how institutional processes normally work

You’re still the trader. The tools simply formalize what you want your trading business to look like.

Common Failure Patterns We Designed Around

When we spoke with futures traders working with ES, NQ, and GC across different prop firms, the same themes came up:

◇ “I hit the profit target in three days but failed the consistency rule.”
◇ “I passed, then blew the funded account during a CPI spike.”
◇ “I sized up too quickly on a good day and wiped out on the next.”
◇ “I forgot this firm banned trading minutes before NFP.”
◇ “I was net profitable, but my equity curve was too erratic for comfort.”

These issues weren’t about not understanding charts. They were about:

◇ Process gaps
◇ Rule misunderstandings
◇ Emotional decisions that weren’t constrained by any system

Dr. Markets and TradeRx were built to reduce these specific failure modes—not to erase risk, but to give traders a more stable structure to operate within.

What Automation Can Help With—and What It Can’t

A realistic view matters.

Automation can help:

◇ Enforce the rules you configure
◇ Reduce impulsive order entry
◇ Keep you away from clearly defined danger zones
◇ Make your behavior transparently reviewable

Automation cannot:

◇ Prevent all slippage or gaps on fast-moving ES, NQ, or GC moves
◇ Control platform outages, data feed issues, or ISP problems
◇ See or predict every internal decision a prop firm might make
◇ Guarantee that a firm will interpret rules exactly as you do
◇ Stop you from manually overriding your own safeguards

Technests tools are designed to improve your process, not to promise outcomes. You still carry market risk, platform risk, and business risk when you trade.

Scaling Beyond a Single Account

One practical reason we built this infrastructure is scale.

Managing a single $50K evaluation manually is demanding but possible. Managing multiple evaluations or funded accounts across different firms becomes overwhelming without structure.

With a defined process:

◇ Dr. Markets can help you formalize plans per account or per firm
◇ TradeRx can enforce per-account rules rather than blindly copying everything everywhere
◇ You can start to operate more like a small desk than a stressed-out solo trader

Scaling up doesn’t become easy—but it becomes more organized and auditable.

Why Technests Exists

Technests wasn’t built on the idea that traders fail because they aren’t smart enough or don’t have the “right” secret indicator.

We built Dr. Markets and TradeRx because:

◇ Instinct alone breaks under prop firm pressure
◇ Rules are often where accounts die—not charts
◇ Professional trading requires infrastructure, not just ideas

Prop firms are ultimately funding systems and behaviors, not isolated lucky trades. If you want to survive and grow in that environment, you need tools that support:

◇ Rule awareness
◇ Consistent execution
◇ Honest review
◇ A realistic relationship with risk

We’re not promising guaranteed funding or guaranteed payouts. We’re offering infrastructure that helps serious traders bring order to a difficult game.

If you’re trading with NinjaTrader or other compatible platforms and want a way to enforce your own rules more consistently, explore how Dr. Markets and TradeRx can support your existing edge instead of trying to replace it.
